text.text_translated:
Earthquakes are strong shakes of the ground.  
Earthquakes damage all structures, including bridges.  
But bridges do not fall often.  
This is especially true for modern bridges.  
Engineers design bridges in earthquake areas.  
They build them on ground that is resistant to movement.

best_attempt.text_translated:
Earthquakes are big shakes of the ground.  
Earthquakes damage all structures, such as bridges.  
Luckily, modern bridges do not fall down often.  
Engineers design bridges for earthquake zones.  
They build them on ground that does not move much.
